Therefore, we must use the Knuth-Yao optimization to reduce the inner loop. The Knuth-Yao optimization for optimal BST: 

        We define:
            dp[i][j] = minimum cost for the segment [i, j]
            and we have:
                dp[i][j] = min_{i<=k<=j} { dp[i][k-1] + dp[k+1][j] } + w(i,j)

            and if the weight function w(i,j) satisfies:
                w(i,j) is monotone: w(i,j) + w(i',j') <= w(i,j') + w(i',j) for i<=i'<=j<=j'
                and w is also bounded, then we can define K[i][j] = the smallest index k that minimizes dp[i][j] (or any index) and we have:

                K[i][j-1] <= K[i][j] <= K[i+1][j]

        Then we can iterate k from K[i][j-1] to K[i+1][j] in the inner loop.
